page.title: 18STEVENAGE CYCLEWAYS
page.content: Stevenage was planned from the start to allow safe movement of all kinds of traffic. Since 1962 most new housing estates have been built on the Radburn principle,separating motorists from pedestrians. Provision has also been made for cyclists by means of a system of cycleways covering about 40 kilometres. This minature highway network runs alongside the primary routes with underpasses at all major junctions. The system was designed mainly to cater for journeys to work, school and to reach the town centre.Wherever possible links have also been made with the parks and recreation areas. The most popular length of the cycleways has been known to carry over 1100 cycles and mopeds per hour at peak travel time. The cycleways have helped to make the town one of the safest in Britain.
